column4: If I were to install ubuntu on my ps3, is it possible to get it back off and have a factory ps3 again?
what is it you want to do with Ubuntu on the PS3?
i watch tons of downloaded content using only XMB on the PS3
XMB?  googling
Xross Media Bar. the default PS3 OS.
how would i access my samba shares?
you don't. you use MediaTomb.
this looks like you would just use the ps3 browser to navigate to a share, correct?  the browser in my ps3 is not fullscreen though
nope, the MediaTomb share shows up as a browseable device on the PS3, like an external USB device.
ahh ok...think i should install this on my ubutnu-server fileserver machine or on my gentoo desktop machine?
Ubuntu server. it's apackaged :)
i guess what i was asking is if there's a GUI
if you're doing this now, i'll give you the 2 lines you'll need in MediaTomb's .conf to make the PS3 feel sexy.
what better time to do it?
nope. there's a web UI, but it's unrelated to configurstion.
what release is the Ubuntu server running?
its running gutsy for now, i could upgrade it quick if that would be easier
nope, should be fine
well, i've added the repo, im going to install the 3 packages now
tell me when it's installed and running and i'll help you edit your config
it's installed, but it did not make a ~/.mediatomb directory, nor a config.xml at all
it's /etc/mediatomb/config.xml
sure is, lol.  the mediatomb site says its in ~/.mediatomb :/
see PM
